After each game this season, spanning from March until July, there will be a beer garden held in the back parking lot of the Korea Mart behind MCC. This will be fenced off by 6 foot chain link fencing, owned by FC Arizona. The square footage will be around 1,500 sq ft and it will be setup and taken down for each event. The beer garden will be open from 6pm to 10:30pm on the following confirmed dates: May 12th, 25th, June 2nd, and 23rd. There will be a security guard carding attendees that must be over 21 and there will be 2 off duty mesa city police officers - attendees will not be permitted to leave with alcohol. We will prevent problems with traffic by setting up fencing to only restrict half of the pathway through the parking lot - however given this will be on Saturday nights in the back of the store, we doubt there will be much if any through traffic.

St. Timothy Catholic Church has been hosting an event called “Food Truck Friday” on the third Friday of every month for the past two years. We would like to hold these events all year round, rather than only nine months of the year per our current permit. 

Setup for the event begins around 3pm with the arrival of some of the food trucks that take longer to prepare their food. As the food trucks prepare in our parking lot, our own staff sets up 12 round tables with 8 chairs around each table. They also set up trash cans, conveniently positioned for easy clean up by our patrons.

The event officially starts at 5:30pm, though if people arrive early (at 5 as the get off work), our food truck vendors will likely not turn them away. Food will be served until 8pm. Around that time, as the crowd peters out, clean up begins. Tables and chairs are broken down, trash is moved to the dumpster, and everything is returned to their storage places in the church. That takes about 30 minutes. Everything should be done by 8:30pm. An adjustment would be made to the time during the hotter months (June-August). During those months, our event will start at 6:30pm and end at 9:00pm. 

During the event, the church facilities will be open to the public. A handicap accessible bathroom is available in our chapel and additional facilities are located in the church. Pending need – or other church events that may be happening concurrently – a portable restroom may also be reserved for the Food Truck Friday event. 

In terms of advertisement for the event, a large portable vinyl banner (36” by 72”) is hung on the overhang in front of our church the Sunday prior and additional vinyl banners are placed at the southeast and southwest corners of our property. All other promotions take place in our parish bulletin and on our website.

The existing 8,240 square foot building, all other on-site improvements and landscaping on the southern parcel will remain.  Improvements are planned for the vacant northern parcel to provide additional community center services including a classroom building, vegetable gardens, sport court, equine therapy corral, pool, playground and splash pad, outdoor recreation/grass area, outdoor kitchen, restrooms, and gazebo/ramada.

RE:	Pre-Application Narrative

The owner of this existing Shell Service Station, Maui Majed, has signed an agreement with Chevron to convert this station to the Chevron 20/20 image.  As such, Chevron has certain corporate imaging standards that must be met as part of the licensing agreement.  These corporate imaging standards are show on drawing 2831 Revision 2 and as follows:

•	Install CHEVRON blue ACM on ingress and egress sides of canopy.
•	Install CHEVRON white dimensional ACM on SW side canopy & flat white ACM on NE side canopy.
•	Install LED Downliter Hood on ingress and egress sides of canopy
•	Install LED Accent Band on SW side canopy and vinyl accent on NE side canopy.
•	Install one (1) 25” LED illuminated Hallmark on SW side (north end) of canopy.
•	Install two (2) 24” LED illuminated WordMarks on ingress & egress sides (south ends) of canopy.
	Note:  Total square footage of canopy signage = 48.54 SF

•	Install four (4) combo trash valets.  
•	Install two (2) 3 x 3 POS between columns.
•	Install eight (8) dispenser I.D. flags (on columns) and four (4) gray pump toppers on dispensers.	

PRIMARY I.D./ PRICE SIGN 										
•	Reface two (2) existing cabinets with Chevron Hallmark and Price sign per design.  
•	Paint sign structure and base (including surrounds) to Chevron specifications..

5)	PAINT
•	Paint C-Store, perimeter walls, and monument bases to Chevron color specifications (as shown on drawings).
•	Paint sixteen (16) bollards Chevron white and install reflective bollard striping tape.

We are proposing a new and exciting urban mixed-use community on Main Street at Mesa Drive, The Grid.  The Grid includes retail, office, and residential uses in a mid-rise structure next to Benedictine’s Mesa Campus.  Uniquely, utilizing a surface parking lot and underused parking garage, 

Developed in partnership with the City of Mesa, Benedictine University Mesa, and Palladium Enterprises, The Grid is a unique public-private partnership to bring residential development to Downtown, Mesa.  This partnership will provide student housing for Benedictine’s future expansion and realize the next step in Mesa’s urban vibrant urban vision for the downtown.  As part of this partnership, the project will also include improvements to South Pomeroy, Gateway Park.  

The GRID takes an under utilized parking structure and turns it and the adjacent land into a place, a neighborhood and an instrument that is vibrant, exciting and that is likely to spur additional development into Downtown Mesa.

Our project involves developing the lot on the corner of South 67th Street and East Alder Avenue by building a luxury boat & RV storage facility consisting of two 2,500 sq ft storage structures.        




The parcel is already zoned limited commercial which allows this type of storage.

We have uploaded a complete design package that includes a satellite view of the bare lot, case studies of the proposed building material, 3D renderings looking Southeast & Northeast, Materials / Lighting, and a detailed site plan showing the overall project, floorplan, and landscape design.  Our intent is that this will be a very attractive development, and may spur interest in improving surrounding properties.

This is a relatively small parcel (160’ by 60’) that meets the criteria of the Development Incentive Permit (DIP).  If qualifies for the DIP because:
-	AREA: The total area of the parcel does not exceed 2.5 net acres & has been in its current configuration for more than 10 years.
-	UTILITIES: The parcel has direct access to utilities
-	SURROUNDING DEVELOPMENT: Within a 1,200 foot radius the total developable land is not more than 25% vacant.  Currently it is approximately 7% vacant (see attached satellite view showing the 1,200 ft radius).  In addition, all surrounding lots and parcels were developed in the 1950’s, 60’s, 70’s or 80’s.

The DIP incentives we would like to be granted are modifications to setbacks & onsite parking.  We propose that the setbacks be 5 feet on all sides.  Additionally, we propose no onsite parking spaces. 

Due to the limited size of the parcel, standard setback requirements would make any type of development very difficult. Adjusting the setback requirement to 5 feet on all sides would allow for enough usable space to develop the property.
We have requested a Special Use Permit to eliminate the requirement of parking spaces on our property. Standard parking requirements for Mini-storage (which would be the closest category we could find) would be 4 parking spaces. The main purpose of these parking spaces is to allow for the parking of visitors that would be coming into a sales office to inquire about the availability of units and purchase storage options. Our property, however, would not have a sales office (all leasing would be done online) and visitors would only be on site if accompanied by one of the owners to inspect a vacant space. In this case the visitor would park on our property directly in front of the unit they would be interested in renting – there would be no reason for them to park along the street. Any tenant of a unit on our property would not park a vehicle anywhere on the property other than directly in front of the door of their unit. 
Upon reading the purposes of Chapter 32 of the Mesa Zoning Ordinance: ‘On-Site Parking, Loading, and Circulation’ – we feel that the absence of the 4 parking spaces on our property would not pose any risk of prohibiting ‘efficient movement of vehicular traffic’ on the property itself or in the streets adjacent to our property. Nor would it present a risk of conflict between pedestrian and vehicular circulation. There is no unpaved area on our property that would be used for vehicle parking or movement – therefore dust production would not be a problem. The use of our property will be adequately served with no dedicated on-site parking spaces. There will be no parking demand generated by our property and there will therefore be ‘no detrimental impact on the supply of on-street parking in the surrounding area.’
The landscape design will improve the appearance of the community using native or adapted plant species.  The landscaping will be watered by an automatic drip system and will be maintained appropriately as needed.

Our goal is that this project will be an attractive addition to the City of Mesa and we are confident it will enrich the surrounding area.  We look forward to doing our part to bring this project to fruition.

The proposal is to develop the 102 acre site into a technology campus comprised of seven data center buildings and an on-site electrical substation. Buildings range in area from 175,000 SF to 229,000 SF and will be two-stories tall. Each building will be comprised of computer rooms and their related mechanical and electrical infrastructure. Each building will also be fitted out with a small office component. Buildings will be operated by the property owner and spaces within leased to customers. The development will be secure and private with access from E. Elliot Road will be limited to RagingWire employees, their customers and approved vendors. The developed area site outside the SRP easement will be fenced and. The multi-phase project will be constructed over time in alignment to market demand.

THIS PROJECT INVOLVES AN EXISTING OFFICE BUILDING BUILT ORIGINALLY IN 1972 AT 1102 E UNIVERSITY DRIVE. THE PROPERTY IS SUBDIVIDED INTO 5 SUITES. SUITES 1-2 IS AN EXISTING HAIR SALON, SUITE 3 IS AN EXISTING NAIL SALON, AND UP UNTIL RECENTLY SUITES 4-5 WAS A REALTOR OFFICE. THIS PROJECT INVOLVES THE CONVERSION OF SUITES 4-5 INTO ADDITIONAL HAIR SALONS. THE EXISTING BUILDING IS 3,256 S.F. OF INTERIOR SPACE. THE BUILDING HAS A CENTRAL INTERIOR COURTYARD, WITH ENTRY INTO EACH SUITE FROM THE COURTYARD. ALSO ON SITE IS AN EXISTING 2,900 S.F. COVERED PARKING CANOPY TO REMAIN. SUITES 4 AND 5 CURRENTLY ACT AS ONE SUITE. IT WILL BE SUBDIVIDED INTO 6 HAIR SALON SUITES THAT SHARE COMMON RESTROOMS, LAUNDRY, BREAK AREA, AND LOBBY. WITH THE ENTIRE BUILDING PROPOSED TO BE HAIR SALON SERVICES, A REZONE FROM RM-4 TO LC IS NECESSARY. WE ARE REQUESTING THIS REZONING TO ALLOW THE HAIR SALON USE WITHIN THE ENTIRE FACILITY. WE ARE ALSO REQUESTING A BOARD OF ADJUSTMENT SCIP APPROVAL FOR A NON-CONFORMING SITE. THIS WOULD INCLUDE REDUCTIONS OF REQUIRED SETBACKS ALONG THE NORTHERN, EASTERN, AND WESTERN PROPERTY LINES. ALSO TO ALLOW THE NON-CONFORMING PARKING CANOPY TO REMAIN AS-IS. THE SITE UPGRADES INCLUDE ADDITIONAL LANDSCAPE ISLANDS AT THE NORTHERN PARKING AREA, RESTRIPING THE H/C SPACES TO COMPLY WITH CURRENT REGULATIONS, EXTENDING THE EXISTING SIDEWALK TO THE PUBLIC PEDESTRIAN WAY ALONG MATLOCK STREET, REMOVAL AND REPLACEMENT OF BOTH DRIVEWAYS TO MEET CURRENT COM DETAILS, REMOVAL AND REPLACEMENT OF THE ADA RAMP AT THE SW CORNER OF THE SITE, ADDITION OF A REQUIRED 6' HI MASONRY SCREEN WALL ALONG THE SHARED NORTHERN PROPERTY LINE, ADDITION OF A 4 FOOT HI MASONRY SCREEN WALL TO BLOCK VIEWS OF THE PARKING AREA FROM MATLOCK STREET, A NEW REFUSE BARREL CORAL, AND ADDITIONAL LANDSCAPING THROUGHOUT THE SITE TO COME BETTER IN COMPLIANCE WITH CURRENT CITY REGULATIONS. THERE ARE NO EXTERIOR BUILDING MODIFICATIONS AS PART OF THIS PROJECT. THE EXISTING MONUMENT SIGN WILL REMAIN AS-IS.

This is an interior tenant improvement with demolition and new construction. It is two suites 
which are currently one space, which will be divided for the one tenant to have two separate 
spaces which create the one business. 
Kitty Pause Kitty Café will function as a combination facility – a cat lounge and a coffee house. The cat lounge side is completely separated from the coffee house side by a roof to floor wall. The upper portion of the wall below the ceiling tiles will be safety glass so that patrons can view the cats from the coffee house side. There will be a double entry door between the coffee house and the cat lounge side of the house to assure that no cats or cat dander can enter the coffee house side.  There are two separate air conditioners with separate air intakes and air output vents – one for each side of the house as per Environmental Health Services requirements.  Cats and cat-care related service providers enter and exist through the back-exit door to the cat lounge.
The cat lounge is a feline activity center where patrons will visit with adoptable cats.  A variety of planned activities, such as Yoga with cats and board games with cats, will take place in the cat lounge in addition to unstructured play time with the cats.  The coffee house side of the facility will offer coffees, teas, sweet and savory pastries, cookies, and other sweet treats to customers.  There will be a small boutique area in the coffee house that will feature cat-inspired collectible items for sale.

Project Narrative:

La Semilla Christian Learning Center is a Christian-based organization focusing on child care for ages 1-5. Located at 3050 S Country Club Dr., Suite 23 & 24., the daycare will function within Upon this Rock Christian Church. There will be no architectural changes to the building, and we intend to acquire a special use permit to allow for the daycare to run in conjunction with a place of worship.  

For the Special Use Permit, issued by the Board of Adjustment we propose that this project will advance the goals, objectives and are consistent with the policies of the General Plan and any other applicable City plan or policy. We believe our location, size, design and operating characteristics of the proposed project are consistent with the purposes of the district, where it is located, and follow the General Plan with any other applicable City plan or policy. This proposed project will not be injurious or detrimental to the adjacent or surrounding properties in the area, nor will the proposed project or improvements be injurious or detrimental to the neighborhood or to the general welfare of the City. Adequate public services, public facilities and public infrastructure are available to serve the proposed project. 

Operation Plan:

Days of Operation are Monday thru Friday from 7:00am to 5:30pm. Including myself, there are four staff members. Two of the daycare workers are part-time, and the other two are full-time. The daycare will accept ages 1-5 into the program. Currently we have one class, but will begin to breakout the classrooms by age once we exceed 5 children. 

The indoor play area is currently 357 sq ft, but will be moved to the sanctuary space once we have more than 7 children in attendance. The sanctuary is 1732 sq ft which can accommodate a maximum of 34 children. The maximum number of children we will hold in this facility is 30. 

For the drop-off of a child the parents ring the doorbell, we unlock the door, and use the Procare Connect application for check-in. Once the parent exits, we lock the door behind them. 
For pick-up of the child the parents ring the doorbell and are walked to the classroom to pick-up their child. The daycare or parent have the ability to sign-out the child via the Procare application. Also, we only allow parents and pre-approved friends and family to pick-up their child, no exceptions. 

Spaces in the parking lot are not limited, with easy access north and west of the entrance. Currently, there are no designated parking spaces, if designated parking spaces are required we will reach out to the management company to arrange it. 

The surrounding businesses are varied, but currently, the two suites west of us are vacant, and north of us is a Storage West Call Center. Other businesses include a dentist’s office, lawn mower engine and supply, furniture store, trophy shop and pest control company. It is a quite plaza, will little activity and a lot of available parking. 

We look forward to reaching out to our community and providing child care services to parents, and providing the children with a Christian foundation.

The Project scope includes the following: 
•	Vertical Expansion scope includes five stories over the existing two story north bow-tie of the Cardon Children's Hospital, for approximately 149,173 square feet of additional square footage to the campus. 
•	Infill scope includes 19,500 square feet on the Cardon third floor shell space.   
•	Remodel scope is approximately 27,832 square feet and includes relocating Sophie's Place and Forever Young Zone to the first floor, First Floor Lobby and Third Floor lobby.  The scope includes a 2,500 square foot security TI, location is to be determined.   
•	Central Plant upgrades are required due to the loads for the new square footage existing configuration of the existing chillers.  
•	Site scope includes rebuilding the Big Outside under the New Tower Addition.  Additional Surface parking will be provided in three locations, for a total of 425 additional parking spaces.  
•	Demolition of the Security Building and the 2415 Building are included in the scope and will be replaced with surface parking and underground retention.  The porte cochere at the existing LDR will be demolished, but no building square footage will be demolished at this time.

Evolution Healthcare Clinic_Ambulatory Surgery Center TI
The proposed Evolution Healthcare Clinic Ambulatory Surgery Center TI represents a much-needed use in the east Mesa area.  This two-story building will bring specialized Cardio Vascular diagnosis and treatment to many of the residents in the adjacent 55 and older age restricted communities.  It is currently operating with a 2,500 sw ft cardiovascular clinic on the first floor.  The proposed tenant improvement is planned to include a 5,500 sf Surgery Center with a state of the art Hybrid Operating Room on the first floor. The 3,100 sf second floor is currently used a Storage(S-1) occupancy.  It is proposed that the second floor be converted to Business(B) occupancy.  This building and site was previously rezoned as an LC-BIZ, which limits site to 40 parking spaces with storage on the second floor.  It is proposed per the provided parking study the current 40 parking spaces are more adequate to support a new ASC TI and second floor B occupancy at max capacity.
